job_title: Math Learning Center Teaching Assistant in Panamá
pros: Being an assistant at the MLC is great because you get to review previous coursework while teaching other students. Not only that, it is a nice way to earn a extra moeny. Schedules were quite flexible for me.

The schedules were very reasonable and the library was not opened 24 hours a day, so there was no graveyard shift. Also, the Head Librarian, Mr. Blackie, is a very understanding, patient, and nice boss.
cons: The size of the library is REALLY small, there is barely any space for the books and tables and there is NO space for new books. It is frustrating because the FSU Panama-Canal administration limits the Head Librarian TOO much and doesn't provide the quality that one is paying or tuition.

job_title: Bookstore Student Assistant Manager in Panama City
pros:
Good work environment, tasks are easy to complete, and does not take much effort. 
As a student to can do school work when there is no work to do
cons:
It was a part time job, so there are no benefits. 
It you are an active person it may be not the ideal job since it is a slow environment.

pros: Very nice people, they want the best for you.
cons: Not a lot of potential growth.
